trans-unit.source: Manage virtual network: Load balancer TCP idle timeout
trans-unit.target: Manage virtual network: Load balancer TCP idle timeout

trans-unit.source: **TCP idle timeout** allows a developer to specify a guaranteed threshold for inactivity during client-server sessions involving the Azure load balancer.
trans-unit.target: **TCP idle timeout** allows a developer to specify a guaranteed threshold for inactivity during client-server sessions involving the Azure load balancer.

trans-unit.source: A TCP idle timeout value of 4 minutes (the default for the Azure load balancer) means that if there is a period of inactivity lasting longer than 4 minutes during a client-server session involving the Azure load balancer, the connection will be closed.
trans-unit.target: A TCP idle timeout value of 4 minutes (the default for the Azure load balancer) means that if there is a period of inactivity lasting longer than 4 minutes during a client-server session involving the Azure load balancer, the connection will be closed.

trans-unit.source: When a client-server connection is closed, the client application will get an error message similar to “The underlying connection was closed: A connection that was expected to be kept alive was closed by the server”.
trans-unit.target: When a client-server connection is closed, the client application will get an error message similar to “The underlying connection was closed: A connection that was expected to be kept alive was closed by the server”.

trans-unit.source: [TCP Keep-Alive](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1122#page-101) is a common practice to maintain connections during a long otherwise-inactive period [(MSDN example)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.servicepoint.settcpkeepalive.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [TCP Keep-Alive](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1122#page-101) is a common practice to maintain connections during a long otherwise-inactive period [(MSDN example)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.net.servicepoint.settcpkeepalive.aspx).

trans-unit.source: When TCP Keep-Alive is used, simple packets are sent periodically by a client (typically with a frequency period shorter than the server's idle timeout threshold).
trans-unit.target: When TCP Keep-Alive is used, simple packets are sent periodically by a client (typically with a frequency period shorter than the server's idle timeout threshold).

trans-unit.source: The server considers these transmissions as evidence of connection activity even when no other activity occurs -- thus the idle timeout value is never met and the connection can be maintained over a long period of time.
trans-unit.target: The server considers these transmissions as evidence of connection activity even when no other activity occurs -- thus the idle timeout value is never met and the connection can be maintained over a long period of time.

trans-unit.source: While TCP Keep-Alive works well, it is generally not an option for mobile applications since it consumes limited power resources on mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: While TCP Keep-Alive works well, it is generally not an option for mobile applications since it consumes limited power resources on mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: A mobile application that uses TCP Keep-Alive will exhaust the device battery more quickly since it is continuously drawing power for network usage.
trans-unit.target: A mobile application that uses TCP Keep-Alive will exhaust the device battery more quickly since it is continuously drawing power for network usage.

trans-unit.source: To support mobile device scenarios, the Azure load balancer supports a configurable TCP idle timeout.
trans-unit.target: To support mobile device scenarios, the Azure load balancer supports a configurable TCP idle timeout.

trans-unit.source: Developers can set the TCP idle timeout for any duration between 4 minutes and 30 minutes for inbound connections (configurable TCP idle timeout does not apply to outbound connections).
trans-unit.target: Developers can set the TCP idle timeout for any duration between 4 minutes and 30 minutes for inbound connections (configurable TCP idle timeout does not apply to outbound connections).

trans-unit.source: This allows clients to maintain a much longer session with a server with long periods of inactivity.
trans-unit.target: This allows clients to maintain a much longer session with a server with long periods of inactivity.

trans-unit.source: An application on a mobile device may still choose to leverage the TCP Keep-Alive technique to preserve connections that expect periods of inactivity longer than 30 minutes, but this longer TCP idle timeout enables applications to issue TCP Keep-Alive requests far less frequently than before, significantly reducing the strain on mobile device power resources.
trans-unit.target: An application on a mobile device may still choose to leverage the TCP Keep-Alive technique to preserve connections that expect periods of inactivity longer than 30 minutes, but this longer TCP idle timeout enables applications to issue TCP Keep-Alive requests far less frequently than before, significantly reducing the strain on mobile device power resources.
